TextView.android:text: Here is your chance to feel the passion and live the dream. Defy the traps, time your gaps, jump the bridges and speed through the tunnels. Feel the adrenaline pump though your veins, as Tathva \'12 presents to you Dirt Races. \n\nGet ready to conquer the racing arena, see if the robot of your creation has what it takes to withstand this test of speed, skill and endurance. Stride past the other robots at top speed to emerge the champion of this race.
Design and construct a wired or wireless bot which can race against others. The goal is to complete the given racetrack in the minimum amount of time.

1.The actual arena will be displayed only at the venue.
2.The bot may use any shortcut it finds in the racecourse, but it must complete all the obstacles.
3.Different terrains like concrete, sand, soil, gravel, glass, wood, etc. will be used in the track.
4.Two minutes preparatory time will be given to the teams before the start to study the arena and devise game-play strategies.
5.There may be bridges, inclined planes, wedges, death wells, rotating platforms, and many more surprise elements.
6.Final aim is to reach the finish line before the other bots.
7.The actual arena may or may not have the above mentioned elements.
8.Apart from these, the arena may hold any other such contrivances which will be revealed only at the venue.

1. A team may consist of a maximum of 4 members.
2. Inter­college teams are allowed.
3. All the teams must register for the event on the website.
4. Each team is allowed to have only one bot for both the rounds.
5. The bot must fit into a cube of 25cm x 25cm x 20cm.
6. No external power supply will be supplied at the venue. All teams should arrange for
their own power.
7. The maximum potential difference between any two points should not exceed 18 V
for wired vehicles and 24 V for wireless bots.
8. No IC engines are allowed. The batteries can be placed on the bot or held in hand.
9. In case of wired bots, the connecting wires from the bot to the remote control should
be a minimum of 3 meters in length.
10. Bots cannot be constructed using ready­made Lego kits or any other such
mechanism. But ready­made gear assemblies and wheels can be used. Although the
chassis has to be hand­made.
11. Violating the clause will lead to immediate disqualification.

● *Wireless bots will be given a higher preference in the wild card round due to
design.
● *On the spot registrations are accepted but the racing slots are subject to
availability.
● *Rules are subject to change. Decisions of the officials are final

First	Rs. 10000/-
Second	Rs. 6000/-
Third	Rs. 3500/-

RULES
1. Only two players are allowed into the arena. One to control the bot and the another to
hold connecting wires.
2. There will be checkpoints all along the track. If any kind of human intervention is
required, then the bot has to start once again from the last checkpoint.
3. For example, if a bot falls from a cliff and is unable to get back on the track, then the
Official will restart the bot immediately from the last checkpoint it had surpassed,
while the other team continues to move ahead on its path without stopping.
4. The above policy can be used only three times for a given checkpoint. If a team
cannot reach the next checkpoint in spite of restarting from a previous checkpoint
thrice, it will be disqualified.
5. Also if a bot hasn't moved from its spot for more than 90 seconds, it will lead to
disqualification.
6. In case of wire entanglement, the timers will be stopped and the race will be restarted
from a previous checkpoint.
7. In order to prevent the loss of momentum during such an event, wireless robots are
encouraged.
8. In case of any discrepancy, decision of the organizing panel will be considered
absolute.
